meanings.definition: A small piece of bread that has been toasted or fried until crisp.
meanings.sent1: I love adding crout to my salad for extra crunch.
meanings.sent2: The soup was served with a handful of crout on top.
meanings.sent3: The crout in the salad were so crunchy, they could wake up a sleeping cat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the sound of crout being crunched underfoot.
meanings.sent5: The crout added a delightful crispiness to the dish.

meanings.definition: To cut into small cubes and fry in oil or butter until crisp.
meanings.sent1: She decided to crout the leftover bread for a tasty snack.
meanings.sent2: The chef will crout the bread cubes for the stuffing.
meanings.sent3: As he crouted the bread, the delicious aroma filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to crout the clouds, turning them golden in the evening light.
meanings.sent5: The sizzle of the bread as it crouted in the pan was music to her ears.
